title: Fix: ports stem lengths streching along with the symbol when using width/height
description: Fixes the issue where port stem lengths were being incorrectly stretched during symbol resizing, ensuring they remain at the user-specified length.
body:
Stem lengths are NOT streched — they stay at the user-specified value regardless of the symbol resize                                        
                                                   
The stems appear shorter than the old snapshot because for example: previously they were being stretched by the scale factor (schStemLength × 1.667). Now they're correctly preserved at user provided schStemLength.

This pull request adds support for selecting and viewing contribution data by week in the frontend. Users can now choose from available weeks using a dropdown in the header, and the displayed data updates accordingly.

Refactored codebase to use domain-specific naming instead of generic terms like data, info, value, param. Also fixed redundant filtering logic and removed dead code.

this is aligned with the code guide https://github.com/tscircuit/handbook/blob/main/guides/code.md#3-banned-words

title: Improve animation controls: sub-ms stepping and expanded speed presets
description: Adds more granular animation speed options and allows multiple solver steps per timer tick for faster visual playback and debugging.
body:
### Motivation
- Provide more granular and higher-speed animation presets for faster visual playback and debugging. 
- Support configurations that represent effective speeds faster than the browser `setInterval` minimum by batching solver steps per tick. 

### Description
- Extend `animationSpeedOptions` with additional presets and add a `description` field used for display instead of raw numeric `value`. 
- Compute `intervalMs` as `Math.max(1, animationSpeed)` and derive `stepsPerTick` as `Math.round(1 / animationSpeed)` when `animationSpeed < 1` to allow multiple solver steps per timer tick. 
- Replace the single `solver.step()` in the animation loop with a loop that runs up to `stepsPerTick` steps and stops early if the solver is solved or failed. 
- Update the animation menu UI to show the new `description` labels and preserve selection highlighting. 

### Testing
- Ran TypeScript build (`yarn build` / `tsc`) and it completed successfully. 
- Ran unit tests (`yarn test`) and they passed. 
- Ran linter (`yarn lint`) and no new lint errors were reported.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_699ea31072e0832e9158ceb0e0899bd2)

title: Fix via-region over-porting and incorrect trace visualization by limiting via ports to 4 sides and resolving solved routes into top stubs + tile-scoped bottom segments
description: Fixes via-region over-porting by limiting via ports to a maximum of 4 sides and resolves solved routes into top stubs and tile-scoped bottom segments for improved trace visualization.
body:
* **Cap via-region ports to 4 total** (top/bottom/left/right):
  `generateConvexViaTopologyRegions` now collects all candidate port positions, classifies them by nearest side of the via-region bounds, selects the best per side, and fills up to 4 ports max (deterministic tie-break via key).
* **Resolve solved routes into physical geometry**:
  New `resolveSolvedRoutePoints.ts` converts `SolvedRoute.path` into:

  * **Top-layer stubs** from abstract entry/exit points to nearest via centers
  * **Bottom-layer traces** pulled from `viaTile.routeSegments` for the traversed via region (tile-scoped + rendered once per via-region traversal)
* **Expose helpers on `ViaGraphSolver`**:

  * `getSolvedRoutePoints()`
  * `getSolvedRouteLineSegments()`
* **Upgrade visualization**:

  * Draws per-layer line segments
  * Bottom-layer traces use a distinct color + dashed stroke for immediate visual separation
* **Update fixtures/datasets** (`top.kicad_pcb`, `via-tile.json`) to reflect the new resolved routing geometry and port reduction.

title: 40x typescript code speed

title: Add basic profiling script for solver samples
description: Add a profiling script to measure solver runtime on sample fixtures, allowing easy benchmarking and extension with additional samples.
body:
### Motivation
- Provide a simple, runnable way to profile solver runtime on sample fixtures and make it easy to add more samples for benchmarking.

### Description
- Add `scripts/basic-profile.ts` which declares a `profileSamples` array (seeded with `sample001`) and constructs a `HighDensitySolverA01` per sample.
- The script sets `solver.MAX_ITERATIONS`, runs `solver.solve()`, measures elapsed time with `performance.now()`, and logs the duration along with `solved`, `failed`, and `iterations` fields.
- The script is designed to be executed with `bun run scripts/basic-profile.ts` and is easily extendable to additional samples.

### Testing
- Ran `bun run scripts/basic-profile.ts` which completed and printed timing and status (e.g. `sample001: solve=7316.63ms solved=true failed=false iterations=782607`).
- Ran `bun test tests/dataset01/sample001/sample001.test.ts` which failed due to tests using the `{ timeout: ... }` signature that is not accepted by the repo's `bun:test` typings/runtime.
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` which reported type errors originating from the same test timeout typing mismatch.
- Attempted `bun run format` but no `format` script is defined in `package.json`, so formatting was not run.

------

title: Add --jlcpcb/--lcsc/--tscircuit flags to `tsci import`
description: Adds options to the tsci import command to filter sources for component imports from JLCPCB or the tscircuit registry.
body:
### Motivation

- Allow users to filter the sources when running `tsci import` so they can target JLCPCB or the tscircuit registry explicitly. 

### Description

- Added `--jlcpcb`, `--lcsc` (alias), and `--tscircuit` options to the `import` command in `cli/import/register.ts`. 
- Updated the `import` action signature to accept parsed `opts` and compute `hasFilters`, `searchJlc`, and `searchTscircuit` booleans. 
- Conditionalized the registry and JLCPCB search calls to only run when their corresponding filters are active while preserving the previous default of searching both sources when no filters are provided. 
- Kept the interactive selection and import/install flows unchanged, only feeding them results from the filtered searches. 

### Testing

- Ran typecheck with `bunx tsc --noEmit` and it succeeded. 
- Ran the import test with `bun test tests/cli/import/import.test.ts` which reports the test as skipped (no failures). 
- Ran formatting with `bun run format` which completed successfully.

------
[Codex Task](https://chatgpt.com/codex/tasks/task_b_699fe5b977c8832eab7afcd2cb3e2464)

title: docs: remove bounty details from sponsorship page
description: Removes legacy bounty-specific guidance and links from the sponsorship page, focusing solely on contributor sponsorships.
body:
### Motivation
- Remove legacy bounty-specific guidance and links because the program now focuses solely on contributor sponsorships.

### Description
- Update frontmatter in `docs/contributing/bounties-and-sponsorship.md` to `title: Sponsorships` and adjust the `description` to reflect sponsorships only.
- Replace the opening paragraphs to describe sponsorships and remove bounty framing and bounty-related links (Discord bounty channel and Algora bounty board).
- Remove the tip about spinning the wheel of issues and rewrite the guidance to emphasize consistently contributing high-impact improvements.
- Preserve the existing sponsorship calculation and eligibility details unchanged.

### Testing
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` in the docs workspace and it completed successfully.
- Ran `bun run format` and formatting completed successfully.

title: add support for gr_poly/gr_circle in footprints using circle and polygon smtpads
description: This pull request introduces support for the gr_poly and gr_circle graphics primitives in the footprint processing stage of the KiCad to Circuit JSON conversion. It enhances the ability to handle complex shapes in PCB designs by allowing the use of polygon and circle shapes in surface mount pads. The changes include modifications to the pad processing logic to accommodate these new shapes, ensuring that they are correctly transformed and inserted into the database.

title: improve type safety for footprint graphic elements by using explicit kicadts types

title: Introduces dynamic lbrn layer selection in the preview canvas and upgrades the default rendering behavior to better support multi-layer boards
description: Adds an interactive layer selector UI in the PreviewCanvas, allowing users to toggle between top and bottom layers in real-time, with persistent layer state and improved default rendering for multi-layer boards.
body: * **Interactive layer selector UI** in `PreviewCanvas` * Dropdown menu for Top / Bottom layers * Real-time toggling * At least one layer always enforced * Click-outside + Escape to close * Portal-based positioning with resize/scroll tracking * **Persistent layer state** * `includeLayers` now merges via `options.includeLayers ?? prev.includeLayers` * Prevents unintended overrides during unrelated option updates * **Improved defaults** * Preview now renders both layers (`["top", "bottom"]`) by default * More accurate out-of-the-box multi-layer visualization

title: Add full training pipeline for Flux 2 Klein 4B PCB routing
description: Adds a complete set of scripts for dataset creation, training, deployment, and inference for fine-tuning the Flux 2 Klein 4B model as a PCB trace router, including adaptations from the morphmaker.ai pipeline.
body:
## Summary
- Adds the complete set of scripts for dataset creation, training, deployment, and inference for a full fine-tune of Flux 2 Klein 4B as a PCB trace router (image-to-image editing)
- Scripts adapted from the [morphmaker.ai](https://github.com/zalo/morphmaker.ai) pipeline to this repo's PCB routing domain
- Dataset already uploaded to HuggingFace: [makeshifted/zero-obstacle-high-density-z01](https://huggingface.co/datasets/makeshifted/zero-obstacle-high-density-z01)

## Scripts added

| Script | Purpose |
|--------|---------|
| `scripts/convert_to_lance.py` | Converts dataset images to Lance format, excludes failures, splits train/test (71/18), uploads to HuggingFace |
| `scripts/train_flux2_full.py` | Full fine-tune of FLUX.2 Klein 4B on Modal (A100-80GB) — downloads Lance dataset, converts to imagefolder, runs patched DreamBooth training |
| `scripts/deploy_api.py` | Modal inference API — accepts connection-pairs image via POST, returns routed image via SSE streaming using img2img |
| `scripts/inference.py` | Local CLI client for the deployed endpoint |
| `scripts/patch_disable_precache.py` | Disables latent pre-caching in the diffusers training script to avoid OOM |
| `scripts/patch_klein_full_ft.py` | Converts the diffusers LoRA training script to full fine-tuning |

## Pipeline workflow

```
1. Generate dataset          →  bun run scripts/generate-dataset.ts
2. Convert & upload to HF    →  python scripts/convert_to_lance.py
3. Train on Modal            →  modal run scripts/train_flux2_full.py
4. Deploy inference API      →  modal deploy scripts/deploy_api.py
5. Run inference             →  python scripts/inference.py input.png output.png
```

## Training details
- **Base model**: `black-forest-labs/FLUX.2-klein-base-4B`
- **Approach**: Full fine-tune (all transformer params trainable, no LoRA)
- **Dataset**: 71 train / 18 test images (89 total, 11 failures excluded)
- **Edit instruction**: "Route the traces between the color matched pins, using red for the top layer and blue for the bottom layer. Add vias to keep traces of the same color from crossing."
- **~2700 training steps** (150 epochs over 71 images, effective batch size 4)
- **GPU**: A100-80GB on Modal

## Test plan
- [x] `convert_to_lance.py` ran successfully, dataset uploaded to HuggingFace
- [ ] `train_flux2_full.py` — requires Modal account with A100 access
- [ ] `deploy_api.py` — requires trained model in Modal volume
- [ ] `inference.py` — requires deployed endpoint

title: Add Polyanya-style two-phase merge (usePolyanyaMerge option)
description: Summary Adds usePolyanyaMerge: boolean option (default true)  Polyanya two-phase merge replaces greedy concavity merge as default New mergeCellsPolyanya() function implements the Polyanya meshmerger algorithm Adds unionObstacleBoundaries()  unions overlapping obstacle boundaries via flatten-jscore before constraint edge generation Fixes filterTris gating: always runs when obstacles are present (previously skipped when no edge crossings detected, causing invalid triangles with contained obstacles) Adds resolveConstraintCrossings() as safety net for any remaining crossing constraint edges after union Ports resolveConstraintCrossings to polyanya-ts repo to fix overlapping obstacles producing 0 triangles 9 new Polyanya merge tests  9 new obstacle union tests (48 total) 2 new Cosmos fixtures for overlapping obstacle scenarios (10 presets) Test files reorganized into tests directory Version bumped to 0.1.0  Polyanya Merge Algorithm Unlike the existing greedy concavity-bounded merge which picks the lowest-concavity merge each round (O(n) per iteration, up to 800 iterations), the Polyanya merge has two phases: Phase 1  Dead-end elimination: Cells with exactly one traversable neighbor are unconditionally merged into their sole neighbor. These are pathfinding-useless topology that only add node expansions with no alternative route. Phase 2  Max-area priority queue: A max-heap keyed on combined area greedily merges the largest pair of adjacent convex cells. After each merge, only affected neighbors are re-evaluated. This produces the fewest, largest strictly-convex regions. Both phases use O(1) convexity checks (two cross products at junction vertices) rather than full convex-hull  concavity-depth computation per merge candidate.  Overlapping Obstacle Fixes Before constraint edges are generated, all obstacle boundary rings are collected and passed through unionObstacleBoundaries(), which uses flatten-jscore boolean operations to merge overlapping polygons. This prevents: Crossing constraint edges that confuse CDT Contained obstacles generating invalid interior triangles Transitive overlaps (AB, BC) being missed filterTris now always runs when any obstacles are present (previously gated on hadCrossings, which missed fully-contained obstacles).  Benchmark: merge step only (CDT  staggered rects, 5-run avg)  Config  Rects  Triangles  Greedy merge  Polyanya merge  Speedup  ---------------------------------------------------------------  4x4  16  134  38 regions (43.6ms)  45 regions (4.4ms)  10.0x   8x8  64  422  147 regions (260ms)  148 regions (28ms)  9.3x   12x12  144  902  317 regions (1.4s)  309 regions (182ms)  7.9x   16x16  256  1574  774 regions (3.1s)  532 regions (462ms)  6.6x   20x20  400  2438  1638 regions (5.0s)  815 regions (1.2s)  4.2x   25x25  625  3788  2988 regions (8.8s)  1269 regions (3.3s)  2.6x   Test plan x All existing tests pass  18 new tests (48 total) x Polyanya merge produces strictly convex regions across all test configs x Total area preserved exactly (shoelace formula comparison) x Overlappingcontained obstacles produce valid triangulations x Polygon union correctly merges overlapping, contained, and transitive overlaps x Build succeeds with tsup --dts --format esm x polyanya-ts overlapping obstacle tests pass (previously 0 triangles)  Generated with Claude Code(https:claude.comclaude-code)
body:
## Summary

- Adds `usePolyanyaMerge: boolean` option (default `true`) — Polyanya two-phase merge replaces greedy concavity merge as default
- New `mergeCellsPolyanya()` function implements the Polyanya meshmerger algorithm
- Adds `unionObstacleBoundaries()` — unions overlapping obstacle boundaries via `@flatten-js/core` before constraint edge generation
- Fixes `filterTris` gating: always runs when obstacles are present (previously skipped when no edge crossings detected, causing invalid triangles with contained obstacles)
- Adds `resolveConstraintCrossings()` as safety net for any remaining crossing constraint edges after union
- Ports `resolveConstraintCrossings` to `polyanya-ts` repo to fix overlapping obstacles producing 0 triangles
- 9 new Polyanya merge tests + 9 new obstacle union tests (48 total)
- 2 new Cosmos fixtures for overlapping obstacle scenarios (10 presets)
- Test files reorganized into `tests/` directory
- Version bumped to 0.1.0

## Polyanya Merge Algorithm

Unlike the existing greedy concavity-bounded merge which picks the lowest-concavity merge each round (O(n²) per iteration, up to 800 iterations), the Polyanya merge has two phases:

**Phase 1 — Dead-end elimination:** Cells with exactly one traversable neighbor are unconditionally merged into their sole neighbor. These are pathfinding-useless topology that only add node expansions with no alternative route.

**Phase 2 — Max-area priority queue:** A max-heap keyed on combined area greedily merges the largest pair of adjacent convex cells. After each merge, only affected neighbors are re-evaluated. This produces the fewest, largest strictly-convex regions.

Both phases use O(1) convexity checks (two cross products at junction vertices) rather than full convex-hull + concavity-depth computation per merge candidate.

## Overlapping Obstacle Fixes

Before constraint edges are generated, all obstacle boundary rings are collected and passed through `unionObstacleBoundaries()`, which uses `@flatten-js/core` boolean operations to merge overlapping polygons. This prevents:
- Crossing constraint edges that confuse CDT
- Contained obstacles generating invalid interior triangles
- Transitive overlaps (A↔B, B↔C) being missed

`filterTris` now always runs when any obstacles are present (previously gated on `hadCrossings`, which missed fully-contained obstacles).

## Benchmark: merge step only (CDT + staggered rects, 5-run avg)

| Config | Rects | Triangles | Greedy merge | Polyanya merge | Speedup |
|--------|-------|-----------|-------------|---------------|---------|
| 4x4 | 16 | 134 | 38 regions (43.6ms) | 45 regions (4.4ms) | **10.0x** |
| 8x8 | 64 | 422 | 147 regions (260ms) | 148 regions (28ms) | **9.3x** |
| 12x12 | 144 | 902 | 317 regions (1.4s) | 309 regions (182ms) | **7.9x** |
| 16x16 | 256 | 1574 | 774 regions (3.1s) | 532 regions (462ms) | **6.6x** |
| 20x20 | 400 | 2438 | 1638 regions (5.0s) | 815 regions (1.2s) | **4.2x** |
| 25x25 | 625 | 3788 | 2988 regions (8.8s) | 1269 regions (3.3s) | **2.6x** |

## Test plan

- [x] All existing tests pass + 18 new tests (48 total)
- [x] Polyanya merge produces strictly convex regions across all test configs
- [x] Total area preserved exactly (shoelace formula comparison)
- [x] Overlapping/contained obstacles produce valid triangulations
- [x] Polygon union correctly merges overlapping, contained, and transitive overlaps
- [x] Build succeeds with `tsup --dts --format esm`
- [x] `polyanya-ts` overlapping obstacle tests pass (previously 0 triangles)

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
